1.title: Halibut Howler
1.plot: A fierce wind rips through the island and everyone must take shelter under the General Store. When Wee Rabbit doesn't come to the shelter, Salty and Lily must venture out, into the wind, to find her.

2.title: Wee Rabbit, Big Voice
2.plot: Stag is auditioning singers for his musical soiree. None of the auditionees are quite right - until Lord Stag hears the most perfect voice in the distance. Lily and Gull track the mystery voice down to a most surprising source.

3.title: At Your Service
3.plot: Lord Stag needs a butler for his grand dinner party. Bull is excited to help, but his inexperience in such matters quickly turns a polite evening into something much more chaotic. Lord Stag is cross that his special evening has not gone to plan, until he learns that his guests have had the most wonderful time.

4.title: Mr Parrot
4.plot: A talking parrot arrives on the island and causes terrible confusion.

5.title: Runaway Boat
5.plot: Bull is determined to become a great seadog just like Salty. When he borrows Bertha, Salty's drydocked old boat, Bull finds himself sailing across the island, hopelessly out of control.

6.title: Say Cheese
6.plot: Lord Stag commissions a portrait of himself to hang in the Stag family gallery. When his photography session is disrupted by his enthusiastic friends, Lord Stag becomes very frustrated and sends them all away. Seeing his lonely photograph on the wall makes Lord Stag realize the true value of his joyous Driftwood Bay family.

7.title: Clarissa
7.plot: Salty's boat Delilah is showing her age and Lily is shocked to learn that Salty is replacing her with a brand new, high-tech vessel. The new boat proves much trickier to handle than Salty expected and, when a disaster occurs, Salty has to call on faithful old Delilah to save the day. Delilah is the only boat for Salty.

8.title: Songs of the Sea
8.plot: Lord Stag is hosting a spectacular concert on on board Delilah. The sea, however, proves far too rough and the concert is a disaster. Lord Stag is devastated until Lily arranges a ocean-concert on dry land, using the dry-docked Bertha.

9.title: The Cuttlefish Cup
9.plot: Salty and Lord Stag enter very different vessels into a round-the-island boat race. Lord Stag is certain that engine power will win the day - until he runs out of fuel. Salty, in his wind-powered craft, must sacrifice victory to help his fellow sailor.

10.title: Old Grampy River
10.plot: Lily and Salty get lost on an unfamiliar stretch of river on the far side of Driftwood Bay. Strange noises in the undergrowth remind Salty of a frightening incident there when he was young. These noises, however, prove to be coming from a very friendly source.

11.title: My Fair Hen
11.plot: Hatsie decides that she needs help to become a little more refined and Lord Stag is happy to give her lessons in being posh. The new Hatsie, however, is impossible to understand and everyone agrees that they prefer unrefined Hatsie, just as she is.

12.title: The Houseguest
12.plot: When Lord Stag needs somewhere to stay, Salty reluctantly invites him to the Shiphouse Store. Lord Stag proves to be an incredibly demanding house guest with some outrageous requests. Salty loses patience with his new lodger and soon their friendship is in tatters. Lord Stag offers to help Salty repair an old winch and, in doing so, repairs their relationship.

13.title: Under New Management
13.plot: Lily decides that Nonna needs help to run the Cockle Cafe cafe and recruits Lord Stag. This idea doesn't go down too well with Nonna and she quits, leaving Stag in sole charge of the cafe - with disastrous results.

14.title: The Wanderin' Walrus
14.plot: Lily and Salty discover a very important ship sunk in the waters near Driftwood Bay. The Wandrin' Walrus was the ship that brought the islander's ancestors. Salty is determined to bring the Wandrin' Walrus into dock for the very last time - but the ocean has other ideas.

15.title: Rockpool Roulade
15.plot: Nonna is attempting to cook a very special recipe. Her memory, however, is failing and, though she won't admit it, Nonna struggles to remember the ingredients. Lily steps in to help jog Nonna's memory in a very unusual way.

16.title: Fabulous Darling
16.plot: When Rowena, Wee Rabbit's flamboyant sister, comes to stay, the whole Driftwood Bay community does their hardest to make her feel welcome. Wee Rabbit feels in the shadow of her larger than life sibling and tries to be just as loud and just as popular.

17.title: Spanner in the Works
17.plot: Nonna's pipes need repairing and Salty, being a loyal brother, pledges to fix them for her. Salty's plumbing skills, however, are not up to much and things are soon erupting in a catastrophic way. Stubborn Salty finally relents and lets Hatsie, a real plumbing expert, fix the problem.

18.title: Flying Felicity
18.plot: Lord Stag finds his old motor car, the Flying Felicity, and takes her out for a spin without having her checked by a mechanical expert. Lord Stag's terrible driving leaves a lot to be desired and, when his brakes fail, Lord Stag has a lucky escape.

19.title: Oil Spill
19.plot: Salty over-oils his old winch, inadvertently causing a terrible oil slick in his beloved ocean and, even worse, endangering Puffin. The island pulls together to rescue their seabird friend.

20.title: Big Puffball
20.plot: Muddy Bull is told to leave the cafe until he can clean himself up. Lily goes one better and gives Bull a full, fancy makeover. Bull's friends find his new image funny and laugh at him, without realizing that they are hurting Bull's feelings.

21.title: Peace and Quiet
21.plot: Salty is taking Hatsie for a peaceful picnic. He plans to play her a little song that he's written about his special hen. Lily, however, misunderstands Salty's wishes and decides to supply some music of her own, much to Salty's displeasure.

22.title: Wooly Jumpers
22.plot: It's the annual Driftwood Bay sheep race and Bull boasts that his sheep, Lightning, is the fastest on the island. The only trouble is Bull can't catch Lightning to enter him into the race. Bull decides to dress up as Lightning and enter the race himself.

23.title: Haddock Haul
23.plot: When the Haddock Haul contest becomes mired in controversy, a terrible rift opens up with two teams refusing to communicate with each other. It takes a burnt cake emergency - and a true team effort to prevent a disaster - to heal the divide.

24.title: Parker
24.plot: Salty takes Lily and Gull for a spin in his old submarine. Whilst they are beneath the waves, Lily meets her old friend Snippy the hermit crab. Snippy needs a new shell but can't find a suitable one at the bottom of the ocean. Luckily, Lily's sea treasure is just the thing.

25.title: Drip, Drip, Drip
25.plot: When the island gathers at the Cockle Café to stay out of the heavy rain, it quickly becomes clear that Nonna's roof is a little leaky. Bull, determined to help Nonna, takes it upon himself to fix the problem with destructive results.

26.title: Farewell Puffin
26.plot: Puffin feels the call to migrate with the other seabirds. Salty has a tough time admitting how he feels about Puffin's imminent departure, leaving it too late to open up to his pal. Luckily, Puffin has a change of heart and the two best pals are reunited.

27.title: Nurse Bull
27.plot: Bull is convinced that Salt is unwell. With Lily and Gull's help, Bull takes it upon himself to nurse Salty back to health, with chaotic results.

28.title: The Great Staggerini
28.plot: Lord Stag's lunchtime piano sessions seem to be losing their appeal with the Driftwood Bay audience. With Lily's help, Lord Stag tries to give his act a bit of a lift with some magic.

29.title: Rise and Shine
29.plot: It's early morning on Driftwood Bay and, before the rest of the island is awake, Lily accompanies Salty on his daily trip to the beach. When Lily thinks that Salty is in trouble, she raises the alarm with the entire island. Salty, however, is fine. He was just doing his morning exercises.

30.title: Monster Bash
30.plot: Lord Stag is holding a monster themed party. When Lily and Bull accidentally scare the antlers off poor Lord Stag, the party is very nearly canceled.

31.title: Potty Parsley
31.plot: Nonna leaves Lily in charge of watering her parsley. When Lily uses too much of Salty's powerful plant food, Nonna's parsley grows far too fast. The monstrous herb soon takes over the Cockle Café kitchen. Lily tries to stop the parsley jungle before Nonna sees it.

32.title: Fishing for Dandelions
32.plot: Salty is hosting his annual bring-and-buy sale, when the Driftwood Bay community send their unwanted items to the Shiphouse Store. When an unwitting Bull finds himself being used as a cart horse, things take a chaotic turn and the island must take to the sea in a very unusual fleet of vessels to retrieve Bull's precious dandelion collection.

33.title: Fire!
33.plot: It's midsummer and the day of Nonna's famous Long Lunch. It's hot and when Lily and Bull's carelessness with a magnifying glass accidentally starts a fire, the celebration quickly turns into an emergency.

34.title: Mumsie
34.plot: Lord Stag has a very special visitor, Mumsie. Lord Stag does everything he can to give his mother a nice day but, whatever he does, Mumsie is not impressed. When Mumsie falls overboard on Delilah, the experience prompts her to tell Lord Stag how she really feels about her son.

35.title: Lost in the Garden
35.plot: Lord Stag gets Lily - and the other islanders - lost in his overgrown ornamental garden. They wonder if they'll ever find the way out. It takes Bull and his love of barnacle bread to lead them to freedom.

36.title: The Daily Driftwood
36.plot: Lord Stag decides to publish Driftwood Bay's very own newspaper. With Lily's help, Bull is determined to find a big front page story, but the perfect scoop proves elusive - until Bull discovers that he has been making the news without realizing.

37.title: Beached
37.plot: When a baby whale is washed up on the beach, the islanders can't decide how best to help the poor creature. Bull and Lily quickly realize that a little less talk and a little more action is what is needed.

38.title: Celestial Suprise
38.plot: Salty is heading off on a mysterious mission to see something spectacular. The rest of the island wants to come but, when they take so long to get ready, Salty can't wait any longer and he leaves alone. His friends try to follow and are soon lost in the woods. Salty's guilt at leaving his friends gets the better of him. Luckily he finds his friends and they all manage to see Salty's spectacular sight - the Northern Lights.

39.title: The Proposal
39.plot: Nonna is astonished to be reacquainted with her old flame, Tom, when he appears on the island. He's now the captain of a nomadic dredging boat. Tom wastes no time in asking for Nonna's hand in marriage. Nonna is very tempted - but, when she realizes that, to be with Tom, she'll need to leave Driftwood Bay, Nonna understands where her heart truly belongs.

40.title: Sea Mist
40.plot: Scoutleader Salty is taking the Driftwood Buccaneers out on Delilah to earn their seal spotting badge. When a sudden heavy fog appears, the Bucaneers find themselves alone at sea without Salty to guide them though the mist. Some quick Buccaneer thinking and some friendly seals save the day.

41.title: Bootcamp
41.plot: Nonna decides that the island needs a health kick and insists on everyone embarking on a cross country run. Lord Stag and Bull have other ideas and sneak off to eat one of Nonna's large cakes. Unfortunately their hiding place turns out to be an old boat and soon the naughty duo are floating out to sea.

42.title: The Salty Chicken
42.plot: A storm causes Nolene, a famous country music star, to become stranded on Driftwood Bay. While she waits for her yacht to be repaired, Nolene tempts Salty to form a glamorous singing duo with her. He'll be a big star. Salty nearly accepts Nolene's amazing offer, until he realizes how much he'll miss his friends.

43.title: Guiding Light
43.plot: Salty yearns for the excitement of his old life on the seven seas. The adventure. The drama. When Puffin gets caught in a storm, Salty needs to sail into it to rescue his pal. It seems as though Salty is getting his wish for ocean excitement after all. The storm, however, is so fierce that Salty finds himself lost in the the rough sea. Luckily, Salty's Driftwood Bay friends are on hand to guide him and Puffin home. Salty realizes that he's happy with a slower pace of life.

44.title: Paper Lanterns
44.plot: Lily thinks she might be getting too old to play her imaginative games and, for once, doesn't sail to Driftwood Bay. She stays with Dad who tells Lily all about his childhood and about how he has never lost the love of playing. Lily is amazed to learn that, when he was a boy, Dad would sail to his own island across the way.

45.title: Christmas Crashed
45.plot: It's Christmas Eve and Lord Stag's festive light show brings Santa crashing to the island. A shaken Santa loses his nerve to fly and the island is delighted to realize that they have Santa to themselves. The islanders compete for Santa's attention, and the best presents. They soon realize, however, that there are more important things at stake if Santa won't take to the skies.

46.title: Home
46.plot: Some newcomers to the island need assistance, and fast! A pair of homeless penguins arrive on the island, desperately looking for somewhere safe and warm to have their baby penguin. The penguins need a friendly stranger to take them in, but the island residents are too busy with a party at Lord Stag's to assist. When they realize their mistake, the islanders do everything they can to put things right.

47.title: St Scallion's Day
47.plot: It's St Scallions Day, when Driftwood Bay celebrates its history. Everyone dresses up and tells the story of the journey of The Wandrin' Walrus in one long wonderful song.

48.title: Costa Del Stag
48.plot: Lord Stag announces ambitious plans to develop Driftwood Bay into a busy, brash tourist resort - with hotels, airports and fast food outlets. The Driftwood Bay community is outraged and tries to change his mind, without success. It seems as though the only option for the community is to leave the island, forever. When Stag realizes that his friends are being forced from their homes, he finally sees the error of his ways.

1.title: Honking Haddock
1.plot: On Driftwood Bay, Salty is getting ready for a special lunch with Hatsie and splashes on some of his old Honking Haddock aftershave. When Lily tries to explain to Salty that he smells terrible, he refuses to listen.

2.title: Old Bertha
2.plot: Lily gathers her friends to fix up Bertha - Salty's old boat as a surprise.

3.title: Stop That Pudding!
3.plot: Nonna has taken a tumble, so Salty steps in to cook an important pudding.

4.title: Puffin Muffins
4.plot: Lily finds a whisk on the beach and takes it along to Nonna's baking class. Nonna proves to be a tricky teacher, who likes things to be done exactly how she says, but soon finds she doesn't have any pupils left.

5.title: Starfish in the Sky
5.plot: Lily is determined to see the Starfish Constellation that lives in the sky.

6.title: All at Sea
6.plot: Salty shows Lily just how much fun being at sea can be.

7.title: Silly Seals
7.plot: Lily finds a hooty horn washed up on the beach and on the crossing to Driftwood Bay she meets some friendly seals. Lily is sure she can train the seals to do tricks with her new horn - but Salty isn't so sure.

8.title: Pirate Puffin
8.plot: Lily finds a pirate's scarf on the beach and she decides to search for treasure on Driftwood Bay. Puffin seems like an ideal pirate's shipmate, so Lily swaps Puffin and Gull for the day.

9.title: Harbour Cookies
9.plot: Lily finds a cookie cutter and sets up a cookie stall near the Cockle Café.

10.title: Seaweed Pie
10.plot: An old wooden spoon washed up on the beach inspires Nonna to once again cook her famous Seaweed Pie. Salty leads Lily on a golden seaweed hunting expedition, but he goes a little too far and ends up trapped by the incoming sea.

11.title: Runaway Stag
11.plot: A disaster on the hill to Stag Castle sends a huge statue hurtling out of control.

12.title: Snippy!
12.plot: Lily meets an adorable new friend but finds it hard to say goodbye.

13.title: Splatball
13.plot: Lily recruits players for a brand new game - Splatball.

14.title: Thar She Blows!
14.plot: Lily sees a big mysterious blue rock in the sea - but Salty doesn't believe her.

15.title: Rescue!
15.plot: Bull is spotted in trouble on the Great North Cliff. Lily to the rescue.

16.title: A Bee in a Million
16.plot: Lily helps Bull to try and find his special friend, Bee.

17.title: Time Out
17.plot: Poor Hatsie is overworked on Driftwood Bay and needs some time out.

18.title: The Mystery Key
18.plot: Lily finds an old key washed up on the beach and sets sail for Driftwood Bay to find its owner. After following a trail, which leads her all over the island, Lily finally finds the key's rightful home in an unexpected place.

19.title: Logbook Lookout
19.plot: Salty's precious logbook goes missing and all the evidence points to Puffin.

20.title: The Carnival
20.plot: Lily finds a little hoop washed up on the beach, which is just perfect for the Driftwood Bay carnival. Lily and Bull decide to see how many prizes they can win - but end up unintentionally spoiling the fun for everyone else.

21.title: Windy Things
21.plot: A washed-up ribbon inspires Lily to teach Salty how to fly a kite. After one-too-many disasters, Lily learns that Salty is more confident at sea and comes up with a clever plan to help him fly a kite with ease.

22.title: The Dance-Off
22.plot: Lily and her friends help Salty get his rusty dancing legs back in shape.

23.title: Message in a Bottle
23.plot: It's Gull's birthday and Lily finds a bottle washed up on the beach with a clue inside it. Following the clues on Driftwood Bay leads Lily and Gull to the best birthday ever when they reach the end of the mysterious trail.

24.title: Stop! Watch
24.plot: Lily chases a runaway pocket watch all over Driftwood Bay.

25.title: The Being Helpful Badge
25.plot: Bull is desperate to win the 'Being Helpful Badge'.

26.title: Bedtime Scarf
26.plot: Bull has lost something special - his precious bedtime scarf. An upset Bull is a crash-banging-bonkers Bull, so Lily leads the hunt, searching high and low for Bull's missing bedtime scarf.

27.title: A Very Important Visitor
27.plot: A mysterious important guest arrives to see Lord Stag's sculpture garden.

28.title: A New Arrival
28.plot: Lily uses her beach treasure to create the perfect gift for a baby lamb.

29.title: Plastic Iceberg
29.plot: Lily and Salty discover the biggest lump of pollution they have ever seen.

30.title: Little Flying Light
30.plot: Lily and Bull get very lost on a camping trip when they follow a little flying light.

31.title: The Monster of Wild Rocks
31.plot: Lily and Wee Rabbit are terrified when they hear a terrible monster at Wild Rocks.

32.title: Winter Games
32.plot: Bull is determined to win a medal at the Driftwood Bay winter games.

33.title: Storm-a-Coming!
33.plot: A barometer warns of a bad storm on its way to Driftwood Bay.

34.title: Summer Holiday
34.plot: The whole island is heading to Lord Stag's beach house for some summer fun.

35.title: Bull's Might Fly
35.plot: Bull gets more than he bargained for when he gives Lord Stag a hand.

36.title: Catch That Picture!
36.plot: Wee Rabbit is embarrassed when her picture of Salty makes everyone laugh.

37.title: A Slippery Customer
37.plot: Nonna is not impressed when Lily invites an unusual guest to the Cockle Café.

38.title: Dance Date
38.plot: A terrible mix up leaves Salty thinking that Hatsie already has a date to the dance.

39.title: Help!
39.plot: Hatsie is too proud to ask for help when she gets stranded out at sea.

40.title: Christmas Kerfuffle
40.plot: Everyone is preparing the Cockle Café for a celebration when disaster strikes.

41.title: Funny Fluffy Things
41.plot: Bull's juicy dandelions are replaced by funny fluffy things that get blown away.

42.title: Captain Lily
42.plot: Lily becomes a captain when she and Gull get stranded on Delilah out at sea.

43.title: Sheep Everywhere!
43.plot: Lily and Bull accidentally cause havoc with a game of chase.

44.title: Snowy Sheep Chase
44.plot: A stray sheep leads Lily and Salty deep into a snow storm.

45.title: Shush, Puffin!
45.plot: Puffin knows why precious objects are vanishing, but no one is listening to him.

46.title: Goodbye, Seabird
46.plot: Lily helps Bull find the perfect way to say goodbye to his old friend, Razorbill.

47.title: Fiddlin' Flatfish
47.plot: With Salty missing his old band, Lily puts together a brand new line up.

48.title: Whale Rescue
48.plot: Lily and Salty free a baby whale who shows his gratitude in an amazing way.

49.title: Delivery Disaster
49.plot: Things don't go to plan when Nonna takes over Hatsie's deliveries for the day.

50.title: Next Please!
50.plot: Lily discovers that running the General Store is not as easy as it looks.

51.title: Remembering Grampy
51.plot: Something is on Salty's mind and Lily tries to find out what it is.

52.title: All Aboard!
52.plot: Lily's music inspires the biggest hoedown ever seen on Driftwood Bay.

-1.title: The Salty Chicken
-1.plot: A storm causes Nolene, a famous country music star, to become stranded on Driftwood Bay. While she waits for her yacht to be repaired, Nolene tempts Salty to form a glamorous singing duo with her. He'll be a big star. Salty nearly accepts Nolene's amazing offer, until he realizes how much he'll miss his friends.

imdb.plot outline: Lily is five-years-old and lives with her Dad in a little hut on the beach. Across the way is Driftwood Bay, the island that Lily can see from her window, and it is here that the characters that she has created from her imagination come to life. Every day the sea washes up a new treasure which sparks Lily's imagination about what might be happening on Driftwood Bay, and so, accompanied by her best friend Gull, the clever seagull, an adventure begins as they go across the way to Driftwood Bay.
imdb.title: Lily's Driftwood Bay
plot: Driftwood Bay is a special island that exists in the imagination of Lily, who creates a world of adventure and friendship from different treasures she finds washed up on the beach.::Sixteen South

Lily is five-years-old and lives with her Dad in a little hut on the beach. Across the way is Driftwood Bay, the island that Lily can see from her window, and it is here that the characters that she has created from her imagination come to life. Every day the sea washes up a new treasure which sparks Lily's imagination about what might be happening on Driftwood Bay, and so, accompanied by her best friend Gull, the clever seagull, an adventure begins as they go across the way to Driftwood Bay.::Sixteen South
